meanings.definition: A sum added to an ordinary price or charge.
meanings.sent1: The insurance company charged a premium for coverage.
meanings.sent2: The premium for the upgraded service was higher than expected.
meanings.sent3: Paying a premium for faster shipping seemed worth it at the time.
meanings.sent4: The premium for the luxury car was justified by its advanced features.
meanings.sent5: The premium for the concert tickets was steep, but the experience was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: Of exceptional quality or greater value than others of its kind.
meanings.sent1: She only bought premium ingredients for her famous dish.
meanings.sent2: The premium leather used in the handbag made it durable and stylish.
meanings.sent3: His premium taste in music always led to interesting discoveries.
meanings.sent4: The premium service at the hotel made the guests feel truly pampered.
meanings.sent5: The premium quality of the artwork was evident in every brushstroke.

meanings.definition: A reward or incentive offered as an inducement.
meanings.sent1: The company offered a premium to employees who exceeded their targets.
meanings.sent2: The premium for referring a friend to the gym was a free month of membership.
meanings.sent3: Earning a premium for completing the challenge motivated him to push harder.
meanings.sent4: The premium for winning the competition was a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity.
meanings.sent5: The premium for loyalty was a special discount on future purchases.
